poem:
**The Inheritors**

Amidst deserted fields,  
the youth sow dreams, careful  
of sterile soil. Machines hum  
the harvest hymn, steel roots  
deepening where hope once  
wed the earth. Silent children  
watch their shadows lengthen,  
asking cold winds about tomorrow,  
as the sun slips behind  
a horizon of iron and code.
